title: Remove Duplicates
description: Given a list of items, return a new list containing only the unique elements in their original order.
constraints: Input is a list of primitives (integers, strings).
The order of first appearance must be maintained.

examples.explanation: The second '2' and second '3' are removed, keeping the order of the first appearance.

hints: Use a Set or a dictionary to keep track of elements already seen. This ensures O(1) lookups.
Iterate over the original list and only append to the new list if the element hasn't been seen.
